props.title: Java Variables and Data Types
props.prompt: In this module, you'll learn how to declare and use variables in Java. Variables are containers that store data values. Java requires you to specify the data type when declaring a variable. Common primitive types include int (integers), double (decimals), boolean (true/false), and String (text). Let's start by understanding the basic syntax: dataType variableName = value;
